title: Carbon fourteen
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Warren P. Everote
brief_description: Explains the use of radioactive carbon as a means of determining the age of historic and prehistoric objects; shows how carbon fourteen is being used in studying the process of photosynthesis; and describes experiments at the Argonne National Laboratory, near Chicago, which are being conducted to study the effect of atomic radiation on plant growth.
